Description: Near complete East Greek pottery stemmed plate with upturned rim, mended from 20 fragments; at edge of floor frieze of sets of tongues alternating with rosettes and boxed squares, between broad glaze bands with added red bands lined in white; in tondo circle of alternating leaves and volutes with accompanying dots. Exterior: three sets of two bands on wall, two on stem; outside of foot glazed.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1228)
